DataElement.preferredName: Disease Response Domain Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Version 1.1 International Pediatric Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma Response Criteria International Neuroblastoma Response Criteria Overall Disease Response Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The overall disease response in a target or non-target lesion, using either the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors version 1.1 (RECISTv1.1), International Pediatric Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma Response Criteria, or the Neuroblastoma Response Criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease Response Domain Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Version 1.1 International Pediatric Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma Response Criteria International Neuroblastoma Response Criteria Overall Disease Response
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations._A standardized guideline developed by the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) Working Group in 2000 and revised in 2009, which is an objective response criteria used to assess solid tumor response and to measure change in tumor size for use in adult and pediatric cancer clinical trials. Major revisions in RECIST version 1.1 includes lymph node (LN) measurement, the maximum number of target lesions, the definition of disease progression, as well as the inclusion of and guidance on the use of MRI and FDG PET in the detection of new lesions._A consensus response criteria for pediatric non-Hodgkin lymphoma, based on the change in the sum of the products of the largest diameter and the perpendicular diameter (SPD) for each tumor mass, up to 6; and [18F] fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) uptake for metabolic response assessment._A standard approach to aid in the stratification of neuroblastoma risk and disease evaluation._Including everything._The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations.

Concepts.definition: A domain for disease response evaluations.

Property.preferredName: Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Version 1.1 International Pediatric Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma Response Criteria International Neuroblastoma Response Criteria Overall Disease Response
Property.preferredDefinition: A standardized guideline developed by the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) Working Group in 2000 and revised in 2009, which is an objective response criteria used to assess solid tumor response and to measure change in tumor size for use in adult and pediatric cancer clinical trials. Major revisions in RECIST version 1.1 includes lymph node (LN) measurement, the maximum number of target lesions, the definition of disease progression, as well as the inclusion of and guidance on the use of MRI and FDG PET in the detection of new lesions.:A consensus response criteria for pediatric non-Hodgkin lymphoma, based on the change in the sum of the products of the largest diameter and the perpendicular diameter (SPD) for each tumor mass, up to 6; and [18F] fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) uptake for metabolic response assessment.:A standard approach to aid in the stratification of neuroblastoma risk and disease evaluation.:Including everything.:The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Concepts.longName: Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Version 1.1
Concepts.definition: A standardized guideline developed by the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) Working Group in 2000 and revised in 2009, which is an objective response criteria used to assess solid tumor response and to measure change in tumor size for use in adult and pediatric cancer clinical trials. Major revisions in RECIST version 1.1 includes lymph node (LN) measurement, the maximum number of target lesions, the definition of disease progression, as well as the inclusion of and guidance on the use of MRI and FDG PET in the detection of new lesions.

Concepts.longName: International Pediatric Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma Response Criteria
Concepts.definition: A consensus response criteria for pediatric non-Hodgkin lymphoma, based on the change in the sum of the products of the largest diameter and the perpendicular diameter (SPD) for each tumor mass, up to 6; and [18F] fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) uptake for metabolic response assessment.
A standard approach to aid in the stratification of neuroblastoma risk and disease evaluation.
Including everything.
The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A decrease in the size of a tumor, or in the extent of cancer in the body, in response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A disease that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.
